posts.author: Kaylion
posts.content:
Hello,

A little background on this guy. I'm looking to take this guy through Aielund so max build lvl 37. For a concept im thinking a Mauradin Bronzebeard type fellow, Dwarfish so I can't stand less then 18 Str for long and the focus near the end on more paladin powers. I chose the warhammer for RP reasons as a mighty warhammer just feels right for this dwarvish pally. I chose to drop improved crit due to the minimal range on the hammer, used the extra feat for better will saves as I hear Aielund will need them.

Divine Might and Shield for those sweet boosts and HS to help with tthe self buffing, HS Cat's grace will top out the armour dex bonus as its a standard +4 and the pot will be used before the spell is available.

Looking through the forum I have only found Harper Champion (Dexer) with similar lvls (fighter instead of CoT), the archive has a number of similar builds focused on Divine Smite, and these 2 Tymora's Charismatic Champion (Dexer), and Cin's Harper's Champion, the last of which is the closest to my build spirit but focuses on MIG not CHA.

I have an alternate build to the one below create with Fighter swapped in for CoT, it gains weapon spec and epic weapon spec for significally weaker Will and Reflex saves.

Since this is my first build my main questions are my lvling priority, is it good? And I am not sure on my feat selection, choosing CoT for the increased saves felt right, but losing +6 DMG didn't. I am set on a dwarf cause.....Dwarves! CoT and HS just felt like the right fit for this meleer but if there are any suggestions I can always rethink those. Warhammer could be changed with BattleAxe or, if feats allow, Dwarven War Axe.

Thanks in advance for any help,

~ Kaylion   

*edited as per suggestions below. Main changes are P(24)/CoT(8)/HS(5) to P(22)/CoT(10)/HS(5) which gives higher saves and boosted divine wrath with no negatives. Another change was 14 Con to 12, 12 Int to 14. This allowed full taunt, which helps with the lower AB and additional listen.  Have left original build inside a spoiler.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Don't worry so much about your saves, those are (more) than good enough,
I want you to focus on the two major deficiencies in your build rather,
The race (you already know that, but I had to tell you),
And the AB (attack bonus).

What do you think you should do In order to improve those?

posts.author: Kaylion
posts.content: Ok, what should I be aiming for in regards to the attack bonus? (and yes, I know Human would have made this alot nicer)

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
For a melee-oriented character, the standard is considered to be "at least" 40 AB.
Everything above that makes the gameplay better but after a certain limit, you hit the point of diminishing returns.
Let's try to hit that 40 AB first though, what would you do?

posts.author: Kaylion
posts.content:
I'm not sure, I can change some skill point choices for 20 Str...that only give me one though. I lose 1 already for not going all the way to 40. Bull's Str potion/spell would give me 2 (but that would no longer be naked)

KD and possible IKD would help with that but I would have to rejig the feats to get them and would have to land them first. Changing the skills around for taunt would also be along the same line.

Other then those I am not sure, help is totally needed for the looks of it. I should add I just started playing a few weeks ago and found the OC too easy, currently have a Rogue AA  going through Aielund (persuasive archer) but wanted a pally smash things and a return to some gaming roots as well as work out something different to what I`ve been doing and make a build of my own.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Right, your build if "extended" to forty levels would have an AB of 38,
Taunt is only natural with that much Charisma synergy & can provide you with upwards +6 AB.
Your use of HS is very good, nothing to correct there.
If you know how to use Pally buffs, then your AB will grow much higher than that, covering any "shortcomings" of the initial design.
You could also experiment with a similar build, Paladin(26)/Fighter(6)/Harper-Scout(5) in order to also gain EWS.

posts.author: Kaylion
posts.content:
I am leaning more towards changing the skills up for taunt. Looking at the starting stats, I also changed 2 Con (-37HP) for 2 Int(+40 skill points), lets me almost max taunt and have a remaining 29 for either a search(x-class)/listen(HS) or I could throw them onto Persuade. How does this look? It doesn't change much except skills and the starting stats, makes it more versatile I think though, and I have no idea if extra listen will help without more search.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Here is an idea,
Change your split to Paladin 22/ CoT 10/ HS 5,
Same feats, better saves, much better divine wrath, 5% dispellable.

posts.author: Kaylion
posts.content:
Doing that I would add the CoT in 28-29 and move a pally down to 25. Would give me a taunt dump in the middle of the Pally drought and move Armor Skin up 8 lvls earlier. Also Divine wrath would be improved from 29 as well...
Definately a good tweak. I will use it and I will make a bold named save right before lvling up lvl 28 (Cot 9) incase later on I feel that I needed undispellability. Does Listen work without search? Asking because of Blind fight's "provided the attacker is heard" clause.

Thank you for all the assistance and suggestions without changing the core idea. It's been awesome.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Yes, Listen is independent of Search skill.

You're welcome, Kaylion,
feel free to come with another build-idea when ready.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Hi Kaylion - and welcome! I'm just sticking my fat face here in to say that yes, Listen works without Search, so no worries on that score. Search is essentially an inert skill - you're seeking things that are stationary and immobile (traps). Listen picks up on noises created by movement, so unless some clever bastard's come up with a floating trap, you're sound.

Btw, I'm liking you already. Aielund fan and Dwarf fan, yeah! Just got to swing you away from this Pally nonsense to Monks and DwDs now, then we'll start getting our wall up against these puffed-up arcanists and religious zealots!

Cheers

EDIT: Ninja'd by Valerfor, but what the hell...

posts.author: Kaylion
posts.content:
Hi Stag, thanks. I love Dwarves but sometimes it feels like more of a chore using them. I'm a huge fan of monks but DwD is just a class I can't seem to have any inclination to try. I actually have a run using your Harding Brightwater going that I put on hold for this guy.

Just finished up Act 1, changed Extra turning for KD...I felt the lack of KD, meant to have it in the build and during inital shuffling it got lost. So far pretty good, the wyrm was easier then expected. Was not ready for an entire party in full plate before the Barb's. Made the last part easier.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Kaylion, DD's are not only used in defensive builds, if that is what bothers you.
I can, for example, make a character with full strength & max dc dev crit, almost pure offense & still use DD for it, why?
Because it will give me d12 hit points, two good-saves & around 18 DR along with "Defensive awareness/ Defensive stance".
Since you are indeed a fan of Dwarves, I feel you have misjudged them poor DD's.

posts.author: Kaylion
posts.content: Valerfor, you may be right. I didn't judge it on an only defensive basis, I saw the "I'm a wall, I don't move but try and hurt me" and didn't look past it. I love me some mobility. I'll take another look at it. After all, it's not like I always need to use the stance.

posts.author: Kaylion
posts.content: So Act II complete and part way into III. No further feat changes however ended up not using a Hammer much so far because of a certain pimped out longsword I could use instead. I might take Val's Cast-Iron Bravo out for a spin when this is done... I'm still undecided on str or dex assassin next. Might start looking for a PW.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: Aielund is awesome, but play something else next, before returning to Aielund, so you won't be playing the same thing over and over, which could make you tired of NWN.

posts.author: Kaylion
posts.content: ya, am definately looking around for a PW or a good all the way to 40 Campaign

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Kaylion wrote: ya, am definately looking around for a PW or a good all the way to 40 Campaign
The only 2 modules I can think of that go to 40 are Mines of Twin Summit (solo hack'n slash, ideal for starting after the OC at level 17/18) and Sands of Fate (Ideal after SoU+HotU or the OC+Aribeth's Redemption, at about level 27/28). Of course, Aielund comes close at level 36/37. And Swordflight will eventually reach 40, but still has another couple of modules to come before it's completed.

I'll leave it to others to recommend a good PW

Cheers

EDIT: If you're interested, you can get more info on Mines of Twin Summit from the New full Epic Series of Modules thread in the General Discussion section, while there's more on Sands of Fate and Aribeth's Redemption in the respective threads in the Modules section.

posts.author: Kaylion
posts.content: I downloaded and installed both Mines of Twin Summit and Sands of Fate for when I'm done with Aielund. Then I went by World of Greyhawk to see what all the fuss was about. Untold number of deaths later I realised two things. That place need a definite, this is how im getting to lvl 5 plan AND it is now a Module so I can play it in all its glory until I know it am ready for it without a pause button.

posts.author: Kaylion
posts.content: Well Just finished the Saga and what a ride. The Char was fun and there was very little I would change. The main thing is the weapon focus. The Saga did not have any good Warhammers! I took it upon myself to morph the Longsword/scimicars Paladin weapons into proper dwarven weapons however redoing the Saga I would go with either a Battleaxe or Exotic, Bastard sword and Katana look real nice throughout. I found no real difficulty hitting things even near the end, for the more time consuming enemies Taunt stayed relevant throught.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Glad you enjoyed it, Kaylion! You're right about warhammers - and even Gaston doesn't offer one in the final act! Iirc, the same is true of kukris and morningstars - so that's 3 of my favourites out the window (And I don't think there are many decent flails - great or small - and only one or two quality battleaxes). It is indeed a bit restrictive on what weapons to focus/spec in.

Still, excellent story ain't it! I hope you went with companions - they actually something, for once.

Oh, and I don't know whether you've had a look or not, but going back to the earlier DwD discussion, Mirnaia is currently taking my dex Monk 30/ DwD 5/ SD 5 for a drive through MTS. Yes, it's a mostly defensive build, but it ain't stuck in clay, and has an AB (unarmed) of 41. Just something different to look at.

Cheers - and congratulations!

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
@ Kaylion, for World of Greyhawk, when creating your character select to go in Hommlet instead of Ruki's Island or Borderkeep.
It will make for a much, much smoother experience & overall enjoyment.
Go first to moathouse, then the little dungeon below & then continue with the village of Nulb & the Temple of Elemental Evil, you will hit level five in no time.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Kaylion wrote: Well Just finished the Saga and what a ride. The Char was fun and there was very little I would change. The main thing is the weapon focus. The Saga did not have any good Warhammers! I took it upon myself to morph the Longsword/scimicars Paladin weapons into proper dwarven weapons however redoing the Saga I would go with either a Battleaxe or Exotic, Bastard sword and Katana look real nice throughout. I found no real difficulty hitting things even near the end, for the more time consuming enemies Taunt stayed relevant throught.
SpoilerMany of the weapons and other equipment you come across in the Aielund mods happen to be weapons/equipment the henchmen use. So it helps to know what they use. There is also a lot of monk items, even if there is no monk henchman. There are some very good ranged weapons, both bows and x-bows. In general are most needs for equipment taken care of. If you want to focus on a completely different weapon, you can have weapons upgraded in most of the chapters by NPCs you meet.
